title: Almost 10m jobs from carbon-intensive industries in the UK ‘will be disrupted by 2050’
lead: Almost 52% of these high-emitting jobs are concentrated in the North, the Midlands or Scotland, according to new research

title: South Korea to replace all diesel passenger trains with low carbon high-speed alternatives by 2029
lead: The move is predicted to slash almost 30% of the carbon footprint of the trains used at the moment and reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 70,000 tonnes

title: Guest Blog: David Lewis – A Risk or a Climate Emergency Opportunity?
lead: David Lewis CEng MICE MIET, Managing Director at ista UK, discusses the Heat Network (Metering and Billing) Regulations

title: ‘Meat-eaters contribute nearly twice as much to climate change than vegans’
lead: New research finds that if everyone in the UK switched to vegetarianism for a year, they could save the UK 37,900 tonnes of emissions

title: Government unleashes £213m of new funding to tackle climate change and COVID-19
lead: The money will be used to equip the scientists, universities and research institutes across the UK with state-of-the-art technology

title: Number of UK households in energy debt hit five-year high towards end of 2020
lead: Almost 777,000 households were in debt between July and September 2020, according to a new report

title: Scotland to have its first hydrogen-powered train running during COP26
lead: A car passenger train of ScotRail will be converted into a hydrogen-powered train by Arcola Energy and an industry consortium

title: Average warming in global cities ‘will increase by up to 4.4°C by the end of century’
lead: Average warming across global cities will increase by 1.9°C to 4.4°C, depending on the rate of emissions, according to a new study

title: GE Renewable Energy seals 1GW turbine deal for onshore wind farm complex in New Mexico
lead: Four wind farms are forecast to generate enough energy to power the equivalent of 590,000 homes

title: Poop-powered train to flush away emissions in Britain’s railway network
lead: The train, which is claimed to have ‘net negative’ emissions and does not require charging from the grid, is set to replace diesel trains
